string.text: Oh where am I? Oh my head aches... ah, but who are you?
I'll ask the questions, who are you and how did you get here?
I... I do not remember... there was a flash ... then nothing.
If you want to live you better remember fast. Oh, and if you even think about lying to me I will shoot.

Don't shoot! All I remember is that last evening, my big brother his friends and me came down on a trip, by bus, to look at the 'Dead City'. We were told so many interesting things about the City's mysteries that we were going to solve - we wanted thrills, to play paintball in the ruins and so we took all the necessary equipment. There were ten people with us... In the city centre we were meant to meet a guide- instructor that we'd arranged by phone, but when we entered the gate, suddenly something flashed, it dazzled us and... I can't remember anything else.

What fucking excursion? What paintball? Stop lying to me. The zone is long closed - let alone the centre with the lethal anomalies and mutants that live in this burning hell on earth. The last excursion here was 3 years ago.

What? I'm telling you the truth! It was only yesterday, on the bus with my brother and with the guys. 2000 kopecks we paid the guide to bring us along this deserted road. But where's everyone else? What's going on, eh?

Eh, you don't look too good. The last time people came here was in the autumn of 2008. I was once a guide here, until the second blowout at the CNPP happened, and then an even worse one; it's all coming back to me... damn it... Is it three years already? Now I can remember - the nightmares...
Well then, what year is it now?

Today is October 5, 2011... Fine! I do not know why, but I believe your delusions. Maybe the zone is fucking with you - playing an "evil joke". If so, that means you arrived exactly at the same time as the blowout itself, and for some reason the zone is now sorry... Like me then... Only I don't know why... It is better for you to forget everything that you mentioned to me and don't speak about it to anyone - this is the zone, and any miracles here are better not spoken of. Now let's go; you come with me, you should get your head back into shape, it is dangerous to stay here for too long.
Where are we going? And who are you?

I am Forester - a recluse... We'll go to my cottage in the forest, it's not far. It is necessary to consider what has happened here. I have the sensation of some strange deja vu. Your questions satisfied then? Well, are you ready to go? Only, do not lag behind, and don't run ahead, it is better to follow my trail, in order not to walk into something lethal. The main thing is that we get away from this disastrous place. We'll talk more there.
Well, it seems, I don't have a choice... Go on, I will not lag behind.
Forester, is this city dangerous?

First, there are the lethal anomalies. I hope you would have noticed them as we walked. In addition, mutants, pseudo-dogs they are called, are one of the many sinister creatures of the Zone. They are active, especially at night. We are fortunate that today we have not met one of them. Even after emissions there are zombies. Where they come from is unclear, but here it is dangerous.
I understand. Well, have we arrived yet?
Yes, left of my old gate, there is a transition point to the Forest. You go first, and I will follow you. Do not rush as you get in, just wait for me.
Well, I'll go then.
Is this where you live?

Yes, this is where I pass away the days and nights. I go to the Forest a lot and sometimes I visit the Dead City. I collect various roots and artifacts, and then exchange them for medication and food with the scientists. I live quietly here away from everyone. Well, let's talk about you. It's so strange that I found you in the bus. How did you get there? Some sort of mystery, I guess. I'm at that place once a week. The bus has been there for about three years, since the last explosion at the Chernobyl NPP. Only it has been empty all this time.
Well, I don't understand how it happened. I've told you all I can remember!
Okay okay, do not worry. Listen to me now. You seem to say that the last thing you remember is that you came to the Dead City, along with your elder brother and his friends on the bus, right?
Yes, exactly. And I don't know what happened to him and the other guys, and I don't understand what happened to me - and why, what I last remember, was three years ago...
What happened to the others, I do not know, but about your brother, I'll tell you what I do.
So why were you silent the whole way? I ask you, do you know anything or not?

Do not shout, so much time has passed since that day, and your story is too devilish for what it sounds like. Well, listen. Three years ago as I told you, there was a second explosion at the Chernobyl NPP, and then there was a violent eruption. Almost everyone within range, including those in the City of the Dead, lost their lives. I managed to escape by hiding in the basement of a high-rise building. When I went up two days later, I did not recognize the place where I worked as a guide for the curious onlookers like you. Suddenly everything had changed and the place had become waste-land, I cannot even explain it properly; well, it was as if not 2 days had passed, but twenty or thirty years...
So what happened next?

Well then I realized that I urgently need to get out there, without any special equipment I would not survive as the radiation level was pretty high. I went to the Forest through the south gate, and as I was almost there I saw the bus, the one where I found you this morning, and in it - no one. And then I saw; by the roadside, in the lowlands, a guy that seemed to move. I went up to him, felt his pulse and luckily - he was alive! I had to save him from the radiation, and brought him here to the Forest. The guy was very much like you. I suppose that it was your brother. Later, in this house here in the woods, he told me how he found himself there, where I had found him. His story was the same as yours, so I believe you. He introduced himself as 'Captain'.

Yes, that's right, he was my brother - during our childhood we each had nicknames: he was 'Captain', and I was 'Strelok'. Our juvenile nicknames then developed into the names which our friends began to use. Well, what happened to my brother, and where is he now?

He lived with me for about a month, helped around the place, greatly lamented the loss of his friends and brother ... Kept wanting to go in search of them, as brave as he was, he knew that it was not safe to go to the Dead City - it meant certain death. I went with him once and we nearly reached the southern gate, but we heard the howling and screaming of monsters, and he decided not to risk it. After the second blast, the zone changed into the form in which it remains to this day: mutated animals and lethal anomalies, artifacts with unprecedented properties and constant emissions. The Zone changes after each emission with the anomalies moving and growing stronger and stronger. Five people later arrived at my forest lodge; they were called Stalkers, searching in the zone for valuable artifacts to sell. 'Captain' joined them and walked away, hoping to find you and his other friends. I see that it did not work ... He never returned. Then, six months later, I heard from scientists, camped near Lake Yantar, who had come to learn about the Zone and mutants, of a group of brave men who went to the Sarcophagus in search of valuable artifacts and to solve the mystery of the Zone. Among them, was a stalker, called 'Captain'. That's all I can tell you.

Thank you for what you've told me. I hope he is still there. I must find him, well, or at least find out what happened to him during this time. Maybe he still is still looking for me. If you need help in something, tell me, I'll do anything.
Forester, why are you so grim?
Well, there was a problem while you were absent.
What happened?

Yesterday, a courier from the ecologists was to arrive bringing medicine and food, and to pick up the different roots and a few artifacts which I scraped together for the scientists in the past week. But a recurrent surprise emission happened yesterday, I thought that he simply would not move out of the camp and come within a day or two. But it turns out, he was on his way when the emission occurred. While you were searching for the Mandrake root, he went on the radio to communicate, and heard it was bad. He knew that he had to find shelter in a cave on the edge of the Forest. While he was looking for shelter, he ran into mutants and barely escaped with his life. He's afraid to leave the cave, having also lost the map of the area. He has asked me to come to him.
Well, it is necessary to go and rescue him.

I must get the drugs that the scientists have sent, but my health is poor you know. Listen my son, help an old man and find that ecologist. Help him get here with the medicine and food while I lie down here and let the pain ease. The name of the courier is Associate Professor Vasiliev. I've put the coordinates into your PDA. Find the entrance of the cave, it's amongst the high rocks, and watch out for anomalies and mutants. Now take another med kit, some bandages and a couple of boxes of buckshot just in case.
All right, I'll go look for Assistant Professor Vasiliev.
Are you all right? I didn't expect courage from a scientist! You have a dangerous job here. Have you seen many zombies?

Yes, I'm in one piece. We have to go to our bunker, dry off and relax. At the same time you will get acquainted with Professor Sakharov - he's my chief; he will give you the medicine for Forester which I was unable to deliver. For helping me, you will be rewarded. I have Sakharov's word. And when we get to the bunker, find and talk with Dan first, introduce yourself. He's the commander of the protection unit for the scientist's base.
Well let’s get going to the bunker, even though I'm wet to the skin getting to you through the swamps. Then I can take back a cure for Forester.
Good morning! Are you Dan - the commander of the protection unit for the scientist’s base?
Yes, that's me. Thank you, Stalker, for helping Vasiliev get out of the woods.

Not at all, but I'm not a fighter. The reason I'm here is that I need to pick up a cure from Sakharov for Forester. Vasiliev told me to come to you first. And another question I have: I must find my brother, or at least find out what happened to him. We parted a few years ago under very strange circumstances, but it's a long story ... Have you accidentally met a man who called himself 'Captain' or a name that is similar? We were given these names in childhood; many people were confused, though brother my brother was 2 years older than me.

We all happen to be here for one reason or another ... I've never met a person like you, nicknamed 'Captain', even though we've been here for more than a year. You'd better ask Sakharov, he has met and known many - he is the chief of local scientists and has been in the zone from the very beginning, and another thing: we need very brave fighters, if join us in the 'Clean Sky' faction, it will benefit science.

No, I cannot, I have to go back to the Forest, to Forester, I promised to come back, he needs the medication I'm bringing, I'm in his debt - he's saved me and brought me back alive from the Dead City.
OK, it's up to you. But if you change your mind, then come back to us.
OK, I'll think about it. Can you show me the way back to the Forest?

Only Sakharov can give you those details. When he sends some of his staff to the Forest, he always carefully calculates the safest route to their devices. So go to him, at the same time you will get a reward for helping Vasiliev and you can ask about your brother.
Well, I'm going to see Sakharov.
Good day, Professor.
Yes, yes, I expected you. Here is a reward for helping us.
I didn't do it for a reward. I came for medicine for Forester, and I also need some information.
Well, young man, you should keep the reward for helping us. As for your questions, I will try to answer them. As the drug won’t be ready for a few minutes, we have time to talk a bit.
Thank you, Professor.
I have two questions for you Professor.
You ask, and I will listen to you.
I'm looking for my brother, who must be somewhere in the Zone, we were separated a few years ago, if you can call it that, in the Dead City. And in very strange circumstances.
What was your brother’s name? Did he have any distinguishing marks?

He always called himself 'Captain'. Forester found him, like me, three years ago in the Dead City, and sheltered him for a while, then my brother left to search of me. Forester never heard from him again. My brother and I were like as two peas in a pod, like twins, though he is two years older than me and a little taller. The only thing - he has a big birthmark on his upper lip, right in the middle.

You know, young man, I remember, maybe two and a half years ago I met a stalker named 'Captain'. He and several others with him came to us in the bunker to stock up on science kits and powerful anti-radiation drugs, before the big hike in the centre of the zone. These were the first courageous stalkers who were not afraid to go to the Sarcophagus, in the heart of the Zone to identify its most important secrets. It was said that they did find the Sarcophagus, and made their way into it, but I have no more information about this.

Thank you, Professor. I've learned something. I will find out the fate of this expedition, and what happened to my brother. And the second question: how do I get back into the Forest? I need to go back to Forester.

As you probably already know, in the zone you cannot go the same way twice. The zone is constantly changing and we have to look for and to calculate new routes and find new paths to travel. More or less stable transitions exist only in some places, such as the Bar, the Agropron, the Garbage, and the Cordon. But I'll be able to help you. If you walk to the eastern part of Yantar, to the right of the road into the valley you will see an old damaged bus. Somewhere near it there should be a 'Secret Path' to the Forest. Look closely, but, if you do not find it, come to back to us, we can find a place for you here: the protection of a brave man is always needed. If you can get back to the Forest, pass on my greetings to Forester and give him the medicine that Vasiliev was unable to deliver. Tell Forester that the exchange of artifacts and roots for provisions will take a week, when the courier will return. Food is scarce at the moment so tell Forester to be patient.
Understood, I will find this secret trail leading to the Forest.
I've returned. Sorry it took so long, Vasiliev lost the drugs while running away from the mutants. I had to go with him back to Yantar and get new drugs from Sakharov.
Yeah, things recently went from bad to worse with my health, a stroke of bad luck. Anyway, give me the medicine and food, I can hardly wait, I'm so hungry.
Here, take this quick remedy. But with food being scarce at the moment, Sakharov has asked you to wait a week.
Forester, where are we going to get provisions? I see that your stocks are running low.

We'll think of something ... I hid some in a secluded place, a box of provisions for a rainy day, so to speak. That day, apparently, is upon us. You'll have to go and pick up that box of food. However, it's hidden in the Dead City.
Give me the coordinates, I'll go.

I don’t want you to go alone, but you probably should. Listen to me carefully: I hid a cache in the Club building. The building is one with the columns, just near the place where I found you. I was on my way there when I stumbled upon you. Get in, get the provisions and get back here as quickly as possible. Understand? Oh, my aching heart tells me something is wrong, but it can't be helped, it is necessary for you to go. Here, take another box of buckshot, just in case, and a med kit.
Do not worry, Forester, I'll be careful. All right, I'm going.
Forester, I'm hours late again, I'm sorry, but there was an unexpected situation.
Strelok, I'm glad that you're back safe; I thought you were attacked by mutant dogs. Tell me what happened.

In the Dead City, the Club building was occupied by a group of people who called themselves 'Wanderers'. Their leader is Leila, a stern, but beautiful woman. They found your cache but they gave me the remains of the provisions in exchange for doing a job for them. They also provided me with an assault rifle and an armoured suit, which they let me keep as a reward for helping them. And Leila said that soon, a person who can help me find my brother will be back from a raid.
It's good that you have made some friends. You don't have to stay here with this old man. You'll see, they will help you find your brother ... Well, show me what provisions we have.
There is still half a box, it should last for a week or two, if we ration a bit. Here, take this box.
Who are you?
I'll ask politely, and don't try to run. What's your business here? Answer briefly and clearly.
Okay, okay, don't worry. I came here at the request of someone to retrieve a cache of supplies.
Who's the fool who decided to hide his cache in this rotten place?
He is not a fool - his name is Forester. Have you heard of him?

I've heard of Forester, he's a good guy ... Okay, let's go to our base, it's our home - don't abuse it! There, Leila will deal with you. Follow close behind me. Don't attempt to run. If you stray more than ten metres from me - this would amount to an escape attempt, and you will be shot. Got it?
Yes I understand.
Good day.
Who are you and what is your business here?

My name is Strelok. I came here on behalf of Forester, to pick up a cache of provisions. He himself could not come because he has a bad heart. In general, I live with him, and help him. Our food supply is running low, so he sent me to bring it back.
Well, I know Forester ... And where and has he hidden his cache?
Well, I see I have to be perfectly frank, you guys are serious. Forester’s cache, by his description, is in this building on the first floor, inside the piano.

So now I believe you, because we have already found the box of provisions. Forester hid it poorly, probably thinking that no one comes here. Wrong - this now is our sanctuary. We are called Wanderers, have you heard about us? Did Forester tell you anything?

No, I've not heard of you and Forester did not say anything. I only arrived in the Zone recently. Forester found me under strange circumstances. I am looking for my brother now. Have you heard anything about a Stalker, nicknamed 'Captain'? He is very similar to me.

No Strelok, I don't know this person nor have I heard of him. We have only been in the zone a year and a half, and during this time, except for enemies and the envious we've met no one. We do not attempt to make acquaintances here, we have other goals. People with noble causes tend to stay away from us.
I see. What are you doing in the Zone?

We here unofficially on a mission for an important scientific company. We can't tell you more. We have a peaceful mission, but sometimes you have to shoot, as the zone has many surprises. We must constantly be alert and vigilant. By the way, if you want to buy provisions, ammunition or weapons, then talk to Mozart - he is our 'Trader', he's on the first floor in the room with a piano. He's the one who found Forester's hiding place. Understand?
Yes, I understand.
Tell me, do you have Forester's box?

Quite simply, we do not need someone else to tell us its location, we found the cache ourselves. This is our territory, and all that is in it, belongs to the brotherhood of Wanderers. I'll give you Forester's box, but only on condition that you help us with one case.
Well, I'll work for the provisions. What should I do?

Quite simply, Strelok, go to Demon - he is our head of security; you'll find him in a former labour building, 'Glory to Labour', adjacent to monument to Lenin. We are currently conducting an operation to clear the city from any evil. He will help you. In short, Demon will tell you everything, and give you an automatic weapon with ammunition. I will warn Demon you are coming.
Okay, I'll go to Demon.
I have fulfilled your condition, give me Forester's box.

You are indeed courageous, Strelok. We, the Wanderers, keep our word. Take your box, though we took some things from it. I hope Forester is not offended; it should have been better hidden. We honour and respect your bravery so now you are free to come and go. As for your business about your brother, we have a team member named Grieg. He was in the zone for a long time, joined us from the very beginning, he was employed as a guide, and then permanently joined our ranks. He is now on a mission, but will soon return; maybe he knows something about you brother. I'll let Forester know by radio when he arrives.
Well, I'll wait eagerly to meet him. How do I get back to the Forest?
Go to the guard who brought you to me. He's waiting for you near the entrance to this room and will tell you everything. Without him, you will not find the path to the Forest.
Yes, of course. I'll go talk to him.
Hello, Commander!
How can I help you?
Leila said that you would show me the trail back to the Forest.
Follow me closely and when get near the Forest transition point, I'll mark the spot on your PDA.
All right, let's go.
I'm looking for someone called Demon, is that you?
Yes it is I, Strelok. Leila told me about you. Are you prepared for a job?
Always ready! What do you need done?

We must monitor the entire city; the houses are full of zombies. They constantly appear after blowouts... From where they come we don't know? After the last blowout, my guys cleared a large part of the city, but there is still one five story building to be cleared. It's next to the angular five-storied house with the broken roof. Over there, in one of the entrances, you will find the zombies. Zombies although sluggish, are better not met in close quarters. You'll go alone, my guys are too exhausted from the last mission, and you will prove that you are capable. Here, take this armour, assault rifle and four magazines for it and you be careful, don't be a hero.
Understood. I'll kill these creatures.
I cleared that house of Zombies.
Excellent, Strelok! Keep the rifle and the armour as a reward.
Thanks, now I have to see Lelia, to pickup something that she promised to return.
Listen, Forester, among the Wanderers a trader exists, they call him Mozart...
Did you check his inventory?
Yes, I looked, he has many provisions and some good weapons, and the main thing - the ammo is cheap. But how do you get money around here?

Well, I can offer you money. Scientists from the Yantar bunker need all sorts of roots and artifacts. Especially the Mandrake root, which you got for me recently. They are out of it. What they are preparing is a protective potion so they can enter a lab, where the mind boils from some unknown powerful influence and as yet is unknown to science. As they have no time to search themselves, they are constantly offering me money for every root I find. Mandrake grows only here in the Forest, in places not everyone would look. Why do I charge them? I need the money to buy provisions and ammo.
It's interesting. How much is possible to earn from these roots?
For each root they pay fifteen thousand. A lot of money. I can tell you where you can find some roots.
Come on, tell me!

Okay, I know where you can find three Mandrake roots. Do not take them to the scientists - they are highly prized. Sell or exchange the roots only with me personally. I've got the money - about two months ago, I scraped together a large number of roots and artifacts for the scientists, they not only gave me provisions, but also insisted that I take the money. The money lies idle, and I see that you need it. It would be simple to just give it to you - but this would be incorrect, I prefer that you earn it. Agreed?
Of course I agree, tell me where to look for the plants.

Do you remember the place in the swamp where Vasiliev showed you the transition to Yantar? Well it's no longer the transition; the scientists have temporarily closed the short road from the Forest to Yantar. Now there's just a hole - the entrance to an underwater cave. Over there, in the cave, you'll find the Mandrake. Find the three roots, bring them to me, and I'll give you money, 45,000 rubles. I'll give you some buckshot and a med kit to take with you, just be careful out there! The exit to the cave will lead you straight to the slope of the ravine, near the lake.
Understood. I'm going.
Forester I brought the three roots!
Honestly speaking, I was afraid to go into that cave.

You had every reason to be afraid, there were some kind of evil flying creatures in there. Scary! As I took the third root a monster appeared, a hypnotist or something. I barely got out of the cave alive.

Flying creatures - they're poltergeists. They are cowardly, but dangerous if confronted face on. The hypnotist - is the Controller. He is a terrible insidious creature. It is agreeable then, give me the roots and keep the honestly earned money and go rest.
Here take the roots. I'll go walk for a little, as my hands still shake, when I think about the cave.
Well, Forester, was there any news while I was in the cave at the swamp?
Leila told me that the man you were expecting has arrived. So again, you must return to the City, you may not return for some time...
Come Forester, don't worry. You have provisions and the roots. I must go quickly to find out about my brother. And return soon I hope.
Okay Strelok, do not worry about me. Go to Leila she's waiting for you. The secret path from the Forest to the Dead City you already know.
I must go now Forester. I will definitely be back!
Hail soldier!
If you are going to Leila do not divert, go to our sanctuary, you know the way. If you are going to the Forest, then you may leave.
I'm on my way.
Hello Sister!
Don’t get smart with me Strelok. Do I look like your sister? Are you still looking for your brother?
I got your message. You told Forester that your guide may be able to help me. Did he show up?

Yes, he’s back from a recent raid at the Swamps where we have a checkpoint, and Grieg was in charge. Before you go to him, I ask for your help with a simple matter. He’s not far from here in the building of the former regional committee. It has big red letters above it.
What's the matter you need help with?

Here in the City of the Dead, there's a gang of looters hanging out. They are street boys, thugs of course, but yet still, youngsters. Living in the abandoned houses, trying to sell all they can. Recently their ringleader has appeared - someone called Razuvaev. An ex-convict. But with his arrival, their antics began to get more serious. The gang began robbing not only abandoned houses and shops in the area, but started killing. More recently, one of our brothers, who came back from a raid, was robbed and murdered. We staged a raid on them, but to no avail.
Well, how can I help? Don't you have a small army here?

It's true, but the matter is delicate ... My warriors have sworn all caught will be destroyed. Demon has put a bounty on Razuvaev's head for 100,000 rubles. For the rest, the order is to kill him on the spot without a trial. I don't want to intervene and break the code of the Wanderers, but I don't want needless deaths. I'm not prepared to kill youngsters, even if they are criminals. Do you understand?
Yes I understand. So what do you want from me?

According to my information the leader of the marauders, Razuvaev, together with a group of inveterate murderers and criminals are away for a while from the Dead City. There's a small group led by young kid named Minor. I want you to quietly talk to this band and gave them my offer. Don’t worry; although they are scumbags, they are not killers. Unlikely to shoot a lone Stalker.
Well, what do you offer and where do I find them?

Conditions are simple: I'll give them twenty thousand rubles - for them it's good money, but they need to tell me everything they know about their ringleader: Who is he, where he hangs out, etc., and then get of the Dead City and never return. Otherwise, they will be shot by Demon's soldiers. I’ll note on your PDA their location. Not a word to anyone, except the Khan kids. Understood?
Yes, I understand. Put a marker in the PDA, give me the money and I will negotiate with your 'kids'.
Are you the one called Minor?
Yes I am, and who are you, my uncle?
It does not matter. I was sent to you by Leila, with a proposal.
What proposal? Does she want to invite some young boys around for some fun?
Idiot! She offers you a deal to save your useless life.
You're the messenger of good will? What does our 'saviour' offer?

You rejoice in vain, young man. The Wanderers are preparing to raid your camp. So what choice do you have? Leila proposes this: Tell her who Razuvaev is and where he can be found, and leave this place forever, and in return you will be paid twenty thousand rubles. Otherwise you're history. You choose.
Okay, I'm not a fool, everything is clear. I've got to talk it over with the guys.
OK, I'll wait.
Well, what did you decide?

In short, Uncle, we agree. About Razuvaev we know little. I only know that he escaped from the slammer and is in the Zone, he's assembled a gang and operates on the sly. We met him accidentally, as we had nowhere else to go he took us in. Bear in mind we have no allegiance to him! Where to look for him, we do not know. They say, he hangs around somewhere in an abandoned village near the Peacekeeping Corps, that's in the South Zone.
OK, I'll take your word for it. Take the money and get out of here. Understood?
Yeah OK, Give me the money, and then go 50 metres into the bushes, so that you can't see which way we go. We don't trust you.
Okay here's the money. I'll stand 50 meters away. Then I'll come back and check. If you’ve cheated me I will personally hunt you down and superglue your cracks together.
Well, I dealt with the Marauders.
You persuaded them, and they're gone?

Yes they're gone, they promised not to come back. Sassy guys. Young, still green, but bold. Accepted your proposal and took the money. As for his boss, Razuvaev, they really didn't know much. They say he went deep into the Zone with a group of experienced criminals, and may return soon to the Dead City, but so far no news from him. They say they've heard that he hangs out somewhere in an abandoned village near the Peacekeeping Corps, in the South Zone.

Well, I hope these young idiots have enough brains not to come back here. Thank you, Strelok. Now it's time to go see Grieg. Talk to him, as he is going back soon. He is located near here, in a former party committee building, 'Glory to the Party'. As for the leader of the marauders - we'll catch him in time. If suddenly you meet that young reptile - Razuvaev, in your travels, hand him a flaming firearm 'hello' from me.
Okay, agreed. I'll go see Grieg now. Thank you!
Hello, are you Grieg?
Yes, that's me.
My name is Strelok. Leila said you might be able to help me with something.
Yes, she warned me you were coming. How I can help you, Strelok? Speak.

I'll get to the point; I'm looking for my brother. Several years ago, here in the Dead City we became separated under strange circumstances. Forester, and then also Sakharov who is based at Yantar, said that earlier they had met a man like me by the nickname 'Captain'. All they know is that he and a few desperate guys were planning to raid the Sarcophagus at Chernobyl. Maybe you know something or may have heard of 'Captain' and his team of Stalkers?

Yes, Leila briefly told me about your business. No, I did not personally meet this person, but I do know about that team of 'suicides', who two and one-half years ago attempted to get to the heart of Zone - to the Sarcophagus. You know that very close to the Chernobyl NPP is the city - Pripyat. My partner, also a guide as I was then, led them to the Hotel in Pripyat. No one went there in those days. He returned, and they went on. My companion, God rest his soul, soon succumbed to a high dose of radiation he received in Pripyat ... That's all I know. I do not know where you'll find your brother, or a trace of the group of Stalkers, but in any case, the search should begin in Pripyat. I advise you not to go there though. Disastrous place: high radiation, all teeming with anomalies, and on top of that, about six months ago, some kind of mysterious group, of semi-humans or semi-zombies arrived there. Recently anyone who went there never returned.
Hell...I vowed to find my brother or what happened to him, so I have no other way. I have to go to Pripyat. Will you be able to accompany me there? I'll pay you or work it off somehow.
No, Strelok, I can't be your guide; I have other important matters to complete. But, I can show a path leading from the Dead City to Pripyat, if you do something for me first, agreed?
Of course, I agree! What do I need to do?
Yes, this is a breeze. It is necessary to bring me ten dog tails. The ravine on the outskirts of the Dead City is full of blind dogs.
Okay, I'll return shortly.
Grieg, I shot the dogs. Here are your ten tails.

Thanks. You can get to Pripyat through the Dead City sewer tunnels. We had to close all the entrances to stop mutants coming. Right behind this building in the square there is an old fountain and a white car to the right. Search for the hatch, which is next to it. Be careful out there. And remember, this pathway is one way only, the way back, you will have to find yourself. Well, good luck to you, Strelok. I've been here a while, and will soon leave for the Swamps, where we have a checkpoint. We'll meet again.
Thank you, Grieg! Until we meet again.
Hello, Sergeant!
Strelok, we have been waiting for you, time is short and we must act now. Our hands are itching to ass kick these bastards! Do you have the map of the Bar?
Sure do, here's the map Sergeant.
Good! Now let's decide how to distribute our resources. Aha, all is clear. Enter the Bar and split up into three groups. All right, it's time to act. Are you with us?
I'll follow you. Let's go.

You have special assignments if you wish to do them. Clear the bandit guards at the northern checkpoint to the Bar. I think you can deal with it, and if you take them by surprise they won’t realise what's happening. Then you can eliminate the bandit leader Duke, the guys in the Bar, and the guys in the Prison. I will send in my assault group first, then my snipers, and them me. If you cannot perform one or more of these assignments, them my assault group should be able to do them. I'll send one of my guys to the northern checkpoint, and another to the southern checkpoint. Try not to shoot any of my guys. And if you can help protect me, that would be good. Understand everthing?
Aaahhh, yeah, I think so.
Well Sergeant are you happy with how everything turned out?
Yes, quite so. But we're not here to visit! We'll soon catch up with the rest of General Voronin’s troops and establish a strong Duty base here.
Well good luck to you.
How else can I help you?

General Voronin with three guards and another person have moved from the Garbage to the southern outpost. A few of the bandits led by Borov have managed to get into the Bar area on the south side. It is necessary to protect and accompany Voronin's group, and bring them to me.
I understand, I'll head towards the Garbage, and I hope I will have time to warn the General about the danger.
Greetings, General!
Hello, Strelok! Well, Plichko reported that the Bar territory is now ours, very good news! Has he sent you to escort us?

Yes, exactly. There could still be some aspiring gangsters in the area. Incidentally, Borov made a last-minute escape. We searched but could not catch him. I'm to escort both you and Barkeep to the Bar.
God willing, we'll catch Borov. The main Bar is now ours. We have Barkeep with us, you can't have a bar without a barman. Let's get going to our new residence.
Yes, let's go. Follow me, General.
Well, here we are. How did you like it?

Nice bunker! No worse than the scientist's at Yantar. Beauty! You Strelok really deserve a great reward. Take this, it's from me personally. Visit Barkeep, he has a special gift for you as well. Now it's possible for our remaining brothers, headed by Colonel Petrenko, to move here from the Dark Valley.
Thank you, General. I'll go to Barkeep. I hope we meet again.
Hello, Doctor!
Hello, young man. You, apparently, are Strelok. Feldsher, my pupil and assistant told me about You. Thank you for helping Ghost. We are in your debt.
Thank you Doctor, but it's I, that's in debt to Feldsher, he cleared my brain and returned my memory while I was in Pripyat.
Doctor I have a very important question.
Yes go on.

Have you heard of a Stalker by the name of 'Captain', who two and a half years ago, accompanied by several other courageous Stalkers, tried to penetrate the Chernobyl Sarcophagus near Pripyat, and further? He is my brother. I'm trying to find him, or at least find out what happened to him. A man by the name of Grieg told me that his partner - a guide, accompanied this same group to the centre of Pripyat, they went further on their own, and he returned, but died shortly after from a strong dose of radiation...

Yes, it was a long time ago ... Indeed, a few Stalkers attempted to get to the Chernobyl NPP and the Sarcophagus. But I see that you know this already. Leader or the group was a kind of Captain. Maybe your brother, I do not know, but his friends called him Captain.
Yes Doctor, Ghost and Feldsher were right, you really know a lot. Maybe you know some more relevant details? What happened to them?

How this campaign ended and what happened to your brother, I can't say because I do not know. This story is shrouded in mystery and darkness. Now, after so much time, it all seems a mystery or just a fairy tale. But there is one detail that only I know, and that makes the story very real. In general I've told this to no one. Here are some details may be useful in your quest.
What is this information? How did you find out?

Grieg, whom you mentioned, knows a lot of things - he's an 'old experienced wolf' in a scrape. But he did not really give you accurate information; rather, he simply did not know about a nuance ... that his friend the guide actually brought the group directly into the territory of Chernobyl NPP not the centre of Pripyat. Risked and paid for it with his life...
How did you know that?

The guide, already near death, came to me for help. I couldn't save him ... He stayed with me a week. God knows I did everything possible, but alas, it was all in vain ... So, before his death he told me that he took the risk and, together with those Stalkers moved across the Pripyat River to Chernobyl. He did so because they found in Pripyat several unique artifacts that give a very powerful protection against radiation and Psy-effects. They were all in the belief that such protection would be sufficient for all. Once in the Chernobyl NPP, they found that the background radiation was far too high, and all the protective properties of the artifacts were simply not enough. The group split up. In the Sarcophagus, the artifacts could only provide protection for two, the 'Captain' and Yuri Semetsky. The others returned to Pripyat, and waited for the return of those two. He soon felt a sharp discomfort and had to return from Pripyat. How it began is not known: after a couple of days all hell broke loose, there was a powerful outburst of Psy-energy, which changed the Zone forever. 'Captain' and Semetsky never returned. What happened next no one knows for sure. Then, after some time on stalkers PDA's came the message about the death of Yuri Semetsky that comes to this day. One of the 'old men' claimed to have seen Semetsky alive and well after six months, and then a year after these events. Is it true, I do not know. Soon after people stopped believing the story and it became a legend, and the situation with constant reports of deaths blamed on Semetsky, another unexplained phenomenon of the Zone. There is a simple answer, Strelok. Try to learn from leading figures, can someone still be alive from that group? To do this, you have to go through the entire Zone, starting from here, in the Swamps, and up to the Cordon.
Thank you, Doctor, you have given me hope! I believe that I will find a trace of my brother, and perhaps him.
Doctor, what can I do for you?
There is a matter, exactly for someone such as you, Strelok.
I'm happy to help you.

Here, in the marshes, until recently things were relatively quiet. Well, maybe a pack of dogs or some tushkanos would appear. But these are trifles. And then suddenly there appeared a swamp creature, all my 'patients' are scared. Two barely survived with only broken bones after their encounter with this monster. And last night this brood from hell devoured all the kittens at my refuge. I can tame any animal, but this ... This creature is not amenable to any effect or hypnosis. You have it.
Do I have to find this mutant that lives in the marshes and destroy it?

Yes, that's correct Strelok. You be cautious. I suspect that this beast is one mean machine. It must be a very rare creature. Let us hope it is not like a Tricephalous - meaning you chop of its head and two grow back. Wanderers, well you know them, as I understand you once met Grieg. They have a small base in the western area of the Swamps. They are afraid to even approach the spot where there is supposedly the lair of this Bonebreaker. They have lost a lot of people trying to destroy it. Grieg has said some fantastic things. He indicated that for every bullet entry point into this creature, out pour small spider-looking mutants, and they are very tenacious, and fast. This monster is frightening! Fire and chemical compositions, including acid, do not seem to bother this thing. But I know you'll think of something, you're savvy. But once again I beg you to be careful Strelok. If you feel that you cannot overpower this beast, and then return to me and we will devise a plan.
Do not worry Doctor I've met all sorts of strange things during my travels while you were getting a suntan. So whatever is out there I can handle it.
Yes, I saw ... But this! I've never seen a creature such as this before.
Really young man, did you destroy the 'Bonebreaker'?
Yes, but I had to work hard, very hard!
Well thank you, Strelok! You've saved us from great danger.
Come on, Doc, don't mention it. It will be good not encounter this incarnation of the devil again.
Doctor, I need to get out of here and move on in search of my brother. How do I get out of the Swamps?

You see, young man, moving to Pripyat is not possible. After the latest emission, everything was turned upside down. In fact, you do not need to go to Pripyat at all. From the Swamps you can still get into the Forest and from there on into the Zone. But this path, only the Wanderers know. You need to talk to Grieg about it.

Well, Doc, I'll go to the Wanderers checkpoint and speak with Grieg. I have to go to the Forest anyway, to call on an elderly man in poor health. His name is Forester; he's helped me a lot. Do you know of him?
I know Forester - he's a good man, intelligent and courageous, not afraid to live in a Forest full of anomalies, deadly traps, and mutants. He will tell you how to pass from the Forest to the Zone.
All is clear. So my way back is through the Forest. Thank you, Doctor, I'll be seeing you!
Hello, Grieg! Long time no see.
Hello, Strelok! Well, did you find your brother?

No, Grieg, I haven't found him yet. The Doctor gave me some details that give me hope though, but I need to get back to the Zone. He said that you know the path to the Forest; can you help me get there?
Yes, Strelok, I can show you the transition to the Forest. And from the Forest you can get to the Military Warehouses. Forester will help you get there. But let's have an equal exchange my friend.
Oh, great! All I want is to get back to the Forest to see how an old man is ... What do you need?

Like last time, a mere trifle. It is necessary to check a piece of scientific equipment, what and why - you don't need to know. All that is required of you - is accompanying our expert, Kent, to an abandoned village so that he can test the device. And then, to protect him on the way back, you never know, there all sorts of rubbish around. We would be able to handle it ourselves, but for now, we can't spare anyone from the checkpoint. We recently lost a few people - 'Bonebreaker' tore them to shreds ... We are waiting for Leila to send replacements from the Dead City. If you help us out, then I'll help you, I'll show you the path to the Forest.
I'll do it. By the way, I eliminated the 'Bonebreaker' at the Doctors request, so you no longer need to fear that beast.

You killed the 'Bonebreaker'? Well, Strelok, you're either incredibly stupid or very brave. Anyway as for the escort, if I'm not mistaken, it is better that you do it. It's time to go. Kent is waiting for you, next to the truck at the end of the bridge. Follow and protect him.
I'm on my way.
Hi, are you Kent?
Yes, that's me.
Grieg asked me to escort you to a place where you're going to take some measurements. Is that the instrument you're going to test?
Yes, it is. I was waiting for Grieg to send me some men. I thought that he would send at least three - this is a dangerous place.
Do not worry, the two of us can handle it, just stay close to me, I'll protect you. Let's go.
I told you not to worry. We overpowered those creatures without to much hassle. So, is this the place?
Yes this is the place. Now wait a minute while I quickly check the settings. Then we can get out of here.
Okay I'll wait.
Have you finished taking the measurements?

Yes everything is fine. I still have to make a few adjustments to the settings and everything will be ready. Thank you very much for your help. Go to Grieg and inform him that the job is done, and that the device is functioning properly. I need a couple of hours to finish the calibrations, and then I'll return to the checkpoint.
Another job well done. Take care of yourself.
Task accomplished Grieg. Your man is alive and unharmed.

Well that's good! Look I have marked on your PDA the transition from the Swamps to the Forest. However the path is in one direction only. If you need to go back to the Swamps you will have to find Pathfinder at the Bar. He will help you find the Secret Path back to us here. Understand?
Yes everything is clear. I'm going.
Forester it looks as if I arrived at the right time.
Ah Strelok, you did, I got distracted and these forest cats came down on me - they would have gorged me alive, if not for you. Ugh, these creatures are ugly.
You see, I proved useful to you. Here, take a med kit.
Thank you my son. Here, let me give you something in return. It's a rare recipe for transmuting artifacts. It will be useful to you.
Please do, thank you.
How have you been all this time?
I'm better now, but where did you go? Did learn anything about your brother?
Oh, Forester, so many things happened during that time, there's so much to tell.
Well, then briefly tell this old man what happened.

Well, in short, I was in Pripyat. I lost all memory of who I was. I fell into a 'Crater' anomaly. Then salvation! I was saved by a 'sorcerer' whom they call Mervin. While I was mindless, I was a puppet soldier in the Monolith faction at Chernobyl. Then a pupil of the Swamp Doctor healed me and helped me to get out of Pripyat and to the Swamps. Then I became acquainted with the Swamp Doctor, and learned something about my brother. Now I'm here in the Forest and I need to get back to the Zone.
Yes, my son, over there your life turned. Well, at least now you're alive and well. What plans do have?
Well, I need to get back into the Zone. I was told that you can show me the path leading to the Military Warehouses.

I myself do not know this path, I've never been. But there are some guys, Hunters, they come sometimes to the Forest, to hunt mutants. They collect some of these, and then sell them to the Scientists. They were here just yesterday, they came to my house - we talked about this and that, drank some tea. They have a camp near the big swamp. Their chief - is an experienced hunter named Slouch. Find and talk to him as he knows exactly how to get to the Military Warehouses. I'll mark their position on your PDA.
Good! Give me the coordinates and I'll go find the Hunters.
Hello, are you Slouch?
Yes I am. Who are you and Is there something I can do for you?

My name is Strelok. Forester told me you could help me and show the transition from the Forest to the Military Warehouses. I'm wandering through the Zone in search of my brother, a man called 'Captain'. Have you heard about this Stalker and his team that a couple of years ago made a bold attempt to get to the heart of the Zone, the Sarcophagus?

Ah, so that's it ... Well, a different matter. About 'Captain', I have not heard anything, we normally don't socialise with anyone, we're hermits. The path from the Forest to the Military Warehouses I can show you, but only if you do something for us. I've sent a couple of fighters to shoot wild boars and collect their hooves for sale. My proposal is this, you help them shoot the mutants, and I'll show you the Secret Trail to the Military Warehouses. Agreed?
What choice do I have? I agree. Tell me what to do, and who to see.

Here's the deal! The chief of the operations is Greek. He's the bored looking one. His assistant is Zahar and he's a bit of a blockhead, but knows his stuff. Follow their lead. The mutants should be somewhere in the habitable zone, so that's where you're going. Give them a hand. Oh, if you gather up the right mutant parts then go to Mazai or Zahar. They will exchange all sorts of tails and hooves for ammo and med kits. Okay, now back to business: Go to Greek he will give you the instructions for the forthcoming operation. After the mission is completed talk to Greek again, then follow Sahar to the transition to Warehouses. Agreed?
Yes everything is clear. I'll go see Greek now.
Hello Greek.
Hello stalker. Well, are ready for the big hunt?
I am always ready for anything. Tell me, what's the plan.

It's simple: the three of us will advance together to the location of the boars. You, me and Zahar. Don't get ahead of me as we will have to sneak up on them quietly. The location is close to the swamp. We tracked down a pack of wild boars there this morning. Let's go hunting, but be careful they are insidious creatures. After we've finished, Zahar will take you to the transition to Military Warehouses. Here take three packs of armour-piercing ammunition for the AK, a couple of packs of 'darts' for the shotgun, and I'll throw in a couple of scientific med kits. Ready to go?
Yes, like a Pioneer, I am always ready. Hand over the ammo and let's get going.
Well Greek, we shot all the mutants.
Yes, another job well done. Now as promised, Zahar will take you to the place where the trail begins to the Military Warehouses. Don't get ahead of him or lag behind.
Thank you and good luck.
Well Zahar, are we there?
Yes we are, most psychic one. The path leading to the Military Warehouses begins here between the boulders.
Thank you. Do you have any requests?

Yes, there is one request. I overhead while you were speaking with Slouch that you are looking for your missing brother. With your question, I can't help you, but please bear with me as I have a situation very similar to yours. I'm trying to find someone too. His name is Sobolev. He's a retired military man. We were neighbours for over twenty years. Before the CNPP accident we would go hunting and fishing together, our families were friends too. After the catastrophe our families perished. Since we had no one left, Sobolev and I decided to stay here in the Zone where our families are buried. We began to look for work as guides, first for onlookers, and then for the Stalkers. We knew the place well. But then our paths diverged. I had a falling out with him once, we argued, and I decided to quit and joined the Hunters, and he remained a guide. Where is he now? Oh, for a long time I did not hear anything. I know that he's still in the Zone, but where?
Well there is a network of Stalkers you can search through. Do you have a PDA?
No Strelok I don't. I don't know how to use one. Please, a request from me to you: if you meet Captain Sobolev gave him this letter personally. I want to make peace with him. I miss his friendship.
Okay Zahar, if I find Captain Sobolev I'll pass on your letter. Now I must go, show me where the trail begins.
General I've just arrived here in the Dark Valley.
And what led you here?
My name is Strelok. I'm looking for my brother. I have information that he is in your ranks, as a working guide. He's called 'Captain'. Is he here with you?
Yes he is. We do have in our ranks a person called 'Captain'. An experienced guide who knows the entire area. Just he never mentioned he had a brother. He is a strange guy.
Well he could be my brother. We have long long ago lost each other. So where is he General, where can I find 'Captain', my older brother?
Take it easy, he is here. Go into the courtyard, there is a small building where you'll find him. Then come back to me. I've got some work for you brave one.
Good! Wow I finally found him! I'll be there in a flash.
Uh-e ... 'Captain'??
Yes, Captain Sobolev at your service. How can I help you 'grasshopper'?
Damn! You're not my brother are you?
What do you need? What's going on?
I have trodden the entire Zone in search of my brother. I had suffered so much. In the end I just wanted to end all my suffering and the risk of going mad. Lord, why are you not fair to me?
Stop the hysteria soldier! What's your problem?

Despite the fact that my brother's name is 'Captain' I came here to the Dark Valley to find him. I had received information that a Stalker named 'Captain' was working here for Duty. But here's some irony in fate. I met 'Captain', but not only that...
Yeah, well fate sometimes plays bad jokes on us. I regret that I have become an indirect cause of your frustration Stalker.
Well Captain it's not your fault excuse me for my momentary weakness.
How do I find my brother now? I have no idea.
Don't give up hope Strelok! I'll try to help you. I've remembered something...
What? You know something about my brother?

Yes I know something. Zahar has probably already told you, we were once guides in the Zone, for various onlookers and Stalkers. At about the same time, we heard rumours about an expedition to the Sarcophagus, which was led by your brother, 'Captain'.
Yes, Zahar told me.

Well, I wasn't involved in the raid, but I know a lot about this sortie from a friend of mine, he was their guide. He has since died. He told me that only two went to the Sarcophagus, 'Captain' and Yuri Semetsky. Neither returned, nor were their bodies ever found. All were convinced that they were killed. Sometime later, I met a digger in the Red Forest, near Pripyat. He told me that he saw Yuri alive and well, and allegedly talked with him. Where he saw Semetsky, he did not say. I did not believe him, because the legend of Semetsky had already begun 'The Eternal Stalker'. You probably know yourself about these constant messages on the PDA about his death. In addition to this, he claimed he was a participant in the expedition itself and all, but he and Semetsky, perished. You need to find this digger and ask him where he met with Semetsky and about what they spoke. If Semetsky is still alive and the digger was part of the same group, then maybe your brother is alive too, and you can find him.
Where can I find this Digger?
I don't know, all I know is he calls himself Mahomet. Check with the traders, Barkeep or Sidorovich. They might know something.
You've given me new hope Captain. Thank you! But is there a shortcut from the Dark Valley to the Cordon, and then to the Garbage?
Probably. As for the transition from the Dark Valley to the Cordon, you need to talk to Voronin.
I'll talk to Voronin about the transition to the Cordon, he has some work for me anyway.
Hello! Who are you?
We're tramps and I'm called Tanker. We were recently attacked by Bandits, they left us barely alive. Now we stay here licking our wounds. But who are you and why do you come here?

I'm Strelok. I am looking for my missing brother. By the way, while I was in the Dead City I found a dead body, more a skeleton, of a Stalker, and beside him a journal. In it, among other things, there was mention of a certain instrument called a 'Bioradar'. And it said that a stalker named Tanker knew where a version of this instrument could be found.
So that's it. Was his name Krol?
It could have been Krol, the journal was signed by that name.

I knew Krol. He was a meticulous and attentive man and his journal proves it. As for the 'Bioradar' several prototypes were stolen, and then disappeared into thin air. By the way I had nothing to do with it, if that's what you're thinking. I knew a low-life who participated in this robbery. He then sold one to me. It was a good deal.
Do you have this device now?
No I lost it. Dropped it when we fled from the Bandits.
Why don't you try to find it? It would be a shame to lose it.

It's too dangerous out there. I'm afraid I value my life too much. I can offer you a deal, you locate and bring me my unique gun, a Groza Storm which I also lost, and I'll give you a tip where you can find the 'Bioradar'. You're a man I see who's not afraid to search for items, and to locate this device. I'm sure it will be useful in finding your brother. And I, frankly, want to clear out of the Zone. Are you interested?

You're a dickhead ... 'Bioradar' dropped, Storm weapon lost... and where is your T-38? Also lost? Ahhhh come on, I'm only kidding with you. Your offer suits me fine. Where do I search for your weapon?

It was like this: the boys and I went into the underground Lab X-18 in the Dark Valley. We wanted to get hold of some old documents on a tip from one of the Military guys. He promised to pay well. And there in the darkness we encountered a bunch of mutants. We got cold feet and got the hell out of there. Along the way I stumbled and dropped my gun. You need to search the lower level of the laboratory. I don't remember exactly where I dropped it, it was dark. The gun will still be there mutants that do not need weapons.
Got it, wait here. I will to find your Storm.
Hello T-38, er, I mean Tanker! I found your Groza Storm. It's in good condition.
Thank you! I really thought that I wouldn't see my favourite weapon again. Come here my 'beauty'.
Well you're smart fellow. Have you forgotten what you promised in return? Come on then be honest, out with a tip about the 'Bioradar', and then you can have this weapon.

So listen, the boys and I were hiding from the Bandits in the Wild Territories near the Rostok plant. It's a scary place, normal people don't go there, they tend avoid it. That's where I dropped it. The place is easy to find: you go to the Bar and then go towards the transition to Yantar. You'll reach an unfinished building, continue on 'till you see a green car that blocks a small area. In the courtyard behind this small car is where we hid for a while. That's where you should look. I'll take the journal you found in the Dead City, you won’t need it.
Well I'll take your word for it. Here's your Groza Storm and Krol's journal. Now I must go.
Good morning!
Who are you? This is a closed area. To pass you need a special electronic Military permit. Where is your permit?
I'm working for the Military as a guide in the Cordon. Here's my badge.
Hello Sidorovich.
Why so sad? I have not seen you before. Who are you and why have you come?

I'm called Strelok. I've not been here before. I'm on a long journey and my path has not been easy. Now I'm here. I bring you news from Barkeep. After the last emission he lost all communications. He asked me to deliver you a secret message. Here take this coded letter.
Sidorovich I seek your help in a personal matter.
Wait a minute, while I read what this Sly Fox has to say. So-so ... interesting theory. Yeah ... he laid it on the shelves, you see! Okay what can I do for you?

I'm looking for my brother, he's called 'Captain'. We were separated more than two years ago under very strange circumstances. Well, it's a long story. I have walked almost the entire Zone in search of him, and spoke with many old timers about what might have happened to him, but so far all is in vain. I still have hope of finding him.

How can I help you? I don’t venture out into the Zone too much these days. I get the latest news and gossip from Stalkers and Diggers that come here from time to time, or from Stalker radio chatter, which no longer works here.
Barkeep told me that you know a Digger called Mahomet, an X-Jihadist. He often comes to you. I need to locate him and find out what he knows about my brother.
Yes I know Mahomet. He was just here two days ago. Sold his loot and went back to the Zone.
There's something I don't understand, how do Stalkers get in and out of the Peacekeeping Corps? This is a closed area, you need a permit to enter.

You're a smart fellow, you say you passed through the whole Zone. So you know that there is always a Secret Path by which you can pass unnoticed. Know what I mean? Do you think everybody goes through the checkpoint? No, of course not, in the Zone there always other trails. Peacemakers, they're good guys, though a bit slow in the gray matter. They think they have everything under control, but actually they're wrong. The area is large so they can't control all of the key points and they don't know all the routes. While things are quiet and peaceful they're confident the area is secure. They often come here for a drink. We are, as you say, good friends. It's not their area and who comes into my store does not concern them. The guys from the nearby villages have long gone. They do check everyone's documents. However, since the last emission, all this has changed. Look, anomalies began to appear here and there and the guys told me that they had seen mutants in the Forest. Such is the state of affairs. Surely now the Peacekeepers have their hands full.
Now I understand. But where can I find Mahomet?
How would I know where the hell his legs take him. He's a Digger, he goes where he can smell a profit. You can wait for him here in the village if you like. He should be back within ten days.
No I don't have the time. Is there any way I can get in touch with him? Oh yeah, I forgot, there is a communications problem. What can I do? I desperately need to talk to him.

Okay I'll help you. There's a man coming here soon, he and Mahomet have scheduled a meeting somewhere in the Zone. I'll try to find out where. 'Quid Pro Quo': while you're waiting you do something for me.
Oh, now there's lawyer talk! He-he! What should I do?

Well, I have to reply to the Barkeep. But first, I must think of his proposal. Now you have to see General Smith, at the Peacekeepers base and deliver five bottles of Brandy that he's asked for. It's necessary in these times to stay friends with the Peacekeepers, or they will close me down in no time. Tell the General, that you are my messenger. I'll radio him and tell him you're coming. Fortunately, having connections within the territory works. Ask him if you can help him in any way. Tell him that you're a local, and live not far from here, a place they know well. When asked why you have a weapon, say - you work as a guide for the Military, right. Well, I've prepared what I'll probably say to the Barkeep. When you're all done, come back here.
Yes everything is clear. Give me the Brandy.
Hello General!
Are you the courier from Sidorovich?
Yes, please call me Strelok. I brought you something from him. Here take it.
How can I help out General?
Well I see you are a complex fellow and armed to the teeth. You're not a saboteur, right?
No I'm not a saboteur. Consider me a local guy. I work as a guide for the Military in the Cordon. Now I'm here with Sodorovich’s help. My name is Strelok.

Okay Strelok we trust Sidorovich. Local you say? People like you are an asset. We've had an emergency arise. One of our soldiers has gone missing, Corporal Foster. We sent him with secret despatches to the checkpoint. He delivered them but never returned. We want you to find him. All the details you can get from Colonel Brown. People who help us are paid well.
I'm glad I can help.
Hello Colonel Brown. The General hired me to find your missing Corporal.

We were looking for a person such as you who could help us. The Corporal took the secret despatches to the checkpoint, but never returned. He’s been missing for the past two days. We've tracked the signal from his PDA. The signal is weak, but steady. It's impossible to make contact due to the constant interference. We combed the entire area, but to no avail. He's vanished into thin air. In short, my people are ordinary soldiers, so we need an experienced Stalker like you. I understand you're a guide and work with the Military, correct?
Ah sure, that's right. My name is Strelok. Give me the coordinates of the location where the signal might be coming from and I'll try to find the corporal, or find out what happened to him.

Strelok give me your PDA and I will mark the radius where to search. Be sure to look everywhere, and if you find him alive bring Corporal Foster back here to the base. We will forever be in your debt. Foster is a good guy, and we miss his jokes.
Understood, mark the area where I should search.
Colonel I found Corporal Foster alive and well and brought him back here. He'll tell you what happened.

Well done Strelok. My soldiers spent two whole days searching, but could not find the Corporal, but you found him quickly. The leaders of the Peacekeeping Corps express their gratitude. Here's a well-deserved reward from us. You are always welcome here.
Glad to have helped! Thank you!
Don't be too hasty, there is another matter.
Well hello Corporal.
Thank you, you are my Saviour! There I was thinking that I was a goner, and that these creatures would eat me for lunch. What is your name?
Call me Strelok. How did you manage to become lost?

Oh, Strelok, do not ask ... I don't understand why. I went the usual way as always. Then I had this freak'n buzzing in my head and a feeling that something was controlling me, and more importantly, I did not want to fight back. Well I can't explain it any better. And then suddenly a miracle, and you're standing in front of me. How long have I been here?

About two days, I suppose. This is what happened to you. There was this Controller, he took over your mind and brought you here, but apparently he wasn't hungry, and left you for later. Well, it's time to get out of here they're waiting for us at the base. Let's go!
Well Colonel, do you have more work?
Yes! Just for an experienced Stalker like you.
Well you are obviously exaggerating my abilities Colonel. What's the job?

As you probably already know this used to be a completely normal territory, a common safe area. In other words, a passing point. And after the last emission everything has turned upside down. It seems that this area and this site were affected. Everywhere there is abnormal activity, and we have repeatedly seen mutants. There's got to be a new reason, so another problem has arisen.
Yeah I have noticed that. I'm not a fool. So what do you need?

You see, my people they are only soldiers. Just soldiers. They are not supposed to think and make decisions. You're different, you're an experienced loner, you survive, you don't just live, you think and weigh every step, every action. After all you are always making life decisions. Am I right? You can think for yourself. I'm like you, a loner. It’s always on my mind. Oh well, your experience is needed now.
Colonel, that's enough philosophy, get to the point.

Well I agree that this is no time for philosophy. Where we are now, it's a forced coincidence. We need to do something. Our main base is at another location; not far from here, east of the town in which we are now. We had to evacuate it because after the last emission very strange things started to happen. Everything went mad, officers and soldiers started shooting at each other, the survivors ended up shooting themselves. And then it got worse. We had a scientist with us. He went mad and damaged the radar. Without the radar we are helpless. We are cut off from the rest of the world. There are no communications, the food is all gone, and we cannot get medical aid. This area used to be part of the 'Mainland'. I'm afraid that this territory is becoming part of the Zone. Then finally some mutants attacked the base. We had to hastily retreat from there. We blocked the gates when we left. I can just imagine what's going on in there now.
Yes, it's not much fun here now Colonel. What do you want from me?

They must be eliminated at any cost to win back the base. Then we need to fix the radar and establish communications. You can help us. You have special skills and know all sorts of tricks, as there are abnormal things we have to face. I and five soldiers will go with you. I can't spare any more. We can't go to this base with regular troops it's way too dangerous. Well do you agree? I will not wait long, and you will be rewarded.
Okay I'm in! When do we go?

We go now! No need to hurry, just stay close. Five men are already waiting for us there. When we reach the gates to the base, assess the situation and make a decision on what to do next. Here take this weapon, five packs of armour-piercing ammunition, three F-1 grenades and several med kits. Your going to need this stuff.
Okay hand them over.
Here take them and let's go.
We're all ready.
Good! Well the plan is: I'll remotely unlock the gates and we'll start the assault. May God and the Virgin Mary save us all!
Understood Colonel. Let's do it!
Let's be extra careful.
Well Colonel it's done, the base is back under your control.

Yes it was a glorious hunt. Now we must put everything back in order, and most importantly, fix the radar and establish communications. Thank you, Strelok, you saved us, but there's more to be done. Here, take this well-deserved reward - a universal repair kit with a bio-electronic damage level scanner. It is intended for repairing any type of small arms. It restores 100% functionality. It was created by the Peacekeepers in a secret Military laboratory. The principle of operation is based on the anomalous properties of the Jellyfish artifact. To activate the repair kit, it is necessary to have a Jellyfish artifact in your inventory. After each repair procedure, the Jellyfish artifact evaporates, having transferred all of its properties to the bio-electronic scanner. It is very rare item, use it well.
Oh I've long dreamed of such a thing, thank you!
Colonel you said there's more to be done. What did you mean exactly?

It's good that the base is back under our control, but south of here, there is an abandoned factory with repair shops. They were ... The place is full insidious creatures; they took over the place when we had to abandon our base. Before you came, General Smith sent a small detachment of special forces to explore the place, but they never returned. We don't even have a weak signal from their PDA's. How shitty is no connection ... We urgently need to repair the radar and restore communications.
Are you going to raid the place?
No, I don't have sufficient forces for an assault. I need you to quietly reconnoitre the place. You're good, I know. I've see you in action. Well, will you help us again?
Yes of course I'll help you. What exactly do you want done?

Get in close to the factory and see what's happening now and what happened to our people. Find some trace of the missing group. Then get back to General Smith and tell him the situation. Take this pair of Army med kits just in case, and a couple of F-1 grenades.
Understood. I'm going to investigate.
Hello General!
I see you are in good health Strelok.
Colonel Brown asked me to reconnoitre the old factory, where the repair shops are, where you recently lost your scouts.
Well what was there? What did you learn?

The factory was full of zombies. And I found a Controller there as well, a really dangerous creature, I tell you. Apparently, it took your scouts. I found only one dead body. He had a PDA on which his last words were recorded. Errie to say the least.
Oh damn, we lost a lot of people in the last week. Well we need to repair the radar and get these helicopters back in the air to rid ourselves of these mothers of all evils.
Yes General I copy that. If I'm no longer needed I need to get back to Sidorovich. There is an important matter awaiting me.

Thank you, Strelok, you saved us, but now we're on our own. I can't give you much in way of a reward - we ourselves, have to do without: ammunition, food and medical supplies are running low. Well, except that I can guarantee you a free pass into our territory at any time. Oh, yes, I have here an automatic carbine M4 machine gun with 100 rounds, I'm sorry, that's all I can spare. Ammo is tight around here.
Thank you! I'll drop back later, but now I have to go. See ya and good luck! Oh, here, take this PDA I found.
Sidorovich you ugly bastard. I'm back.
So your back Jack! Good for you! Did General Smith take the brandy?

Yes he accepted the Brandy happily. It was necessary to do some jobs for the Peacekeepers. I had to find someone who went missing too. Christ. They even got me to help them clean out their old base from mutants. Now they will try to fix the radar and restore communications. I helped get their affairs in order. Now I have them as friends.
I see, but you don't have time to relax. While you were gone I've written a response to Barkeep. Here, I want you to deliver this encrypted message to him.
Okay I'll deliver your message.
What did you find out?

So listen, the stalker came, the one who was going to have a meeting with Mahomet. They have scheduled a meeting somewhere on the outskirts of the Dead City. You'll find him there so don't delay. As to how to get to the Dead City, you'll figure it out.

How do I get into the Dead City? I have an idea. I'll go see the Wanderers in the Swamps. Grieg says he has a stash in the Dead City. He certainly should know how to get there. Oh and then there is the Swamp Doctor, first I need to get to the Swamps, but how?
Good idea you should talk to him. You'll have to go to the scientists in Yantar. They may know a safe path to the Swamps, and perhaps even to the Dead City.
Understood and thank you! I'm going to Yantar now.
Don't forget you agreed to deliver a letter to Barkeep at the Cordon.
Do not worry I'll take it. See you soon!
Good day! Are you Mahomet?
No no, I'm Fima. Who are you and why are you seeking Mahomet?
My name is Strelok. I need to talk to Mahomet about a personal matter. Sidorovich told me I could find him here, and that he had an arranged meeting with someone, probably with you.
Ah, so that's it. Yes Mahomet was here and we did have a meeting. But you're a little late Mahomet has left. Where he went I do not know.
Shit! How was it that I was late, oh well? I really need to speak with Mahomet. Are you really sure you don't know how to find him? I'll pay for good information.

No I don't want your money. I really don't know where he's headed. Mahomet doesn't say much, he's a loner. Sidorovich told me that a Stalker called Strelok was seeking a rendezvous with Mahomet. So there you are.
Yes, that's me. What am I going to do now I can't even imagine.

You'll survive. I told Mahomet about you Strelok, that you were desperate to meet with him. But Mahomet could not wait so he went away. He will find you. As the saying goes: 'If you can't bring the mountain to Mahomet, then bring Mahomet to the mountain'. So don't worry!
How will he find me? Do I have to sit and wait in one place?
Believe me he'll find you! You just don't know Mahomet. If he says so, he'll find you. Moreover he said that he's heard a lot about your exploits and he was not averse to meeting you.
Okay I understand. I really hope that he finds me. Thank you. Be that as it may. See you later.
Hello Leila!
Long time no see Strelok. Were you successful? Did you find your brother?
No I haven't found him yet, but I will. I'm here about another matter.
And what brings you to us?

I do not know where to begin. I was slightly aware of your relationship with Clear Sky. I even learnt about your sister Karina. Okay, more to the point. Sviblov has sent me here. Karina went missing a few days ago. She's just vanished.
What are you talking about?! She was here with a guide. They left here three days ago. Has she not returned to the Radar?
No, she did not return. Sviblov sent people to search for them, but they vanished.

Sviblov, that idiot! Never liked him. Things are not going smoothly in my relations with Clear Sky, but he could at least have told me about my sister. That schmuck! As if evil is not enough, we have to deal with stalkers like him.
Okay don't get angry. Which way did they go back?

She said she knew the way. She and a guide went to the Forest. There is a path from there to the Radar. She said that it's no more than a mile, and then, it's on the edge of the woods, supposedly a safe place somewhere near Forester's hut. I wonder what happened there? We need to find someone who knows. My people don't know the area, and they have never been to the Forest.

I'll tell you what: since I volunteered to help in the search for your sister, then I'll go to the Forest if that helps. The territory is familiar to me, especially since that's where Forester lives. And the hunters are there, they may know something. By the way, is the path into the woods at the same place?

Yes, the passage to the Forest is still at the same place and still being used. Here, just in case, I'll mark your PDA with the beginning of the transition. Please, I beg of you, as soon as you find something about my sister, let me know in any way. Deal?
Yes of course. I'm leaving for the Forest now.
Hello Forester. It's been a long time.
Glad to see you Strelok. How goes your search?

No luck so far, but there is still hope. I need to find a skilled Digger named Mahomet. He may be able to shed some light on this whole complicated and mystical story about my brother. By the way, do you know that Digger, or where I can find him?
No my son, I've never heard of him. What brings you to visit an old man in the Forest again?

Well first to visit you and see how you are doing, and secondly something has happened. A girl Has gone missing, Leila's sister. She and her guide went from the Dead City to the Radar by way of the Forest. They have been missing for three days now. Nothing has been heard or seen of them since. Do you know anything about it?
No, I have not seen a girl. Ask the Hunters, they are still here. They've stayed longer this time, maybe they wanted to gather more tails and hooves, or maybe something else.
Well thank you. I'll go to the Hunters and see if they know anything, they may be able to help me find Leila's sister.
Hello Slouch, long time no see.
Hello Strelok, yes it has been a while. Have you decided to join us or are you on other business?
I've done enough hunting while I've been in the Zone searching for my brother.
Well then tell us why you're here.
