I'm searching for a missing girl. Three days ago, she and her guide left the Dead City for the Radar, by way of the Forest. They never arrived. Do you know anything, did you see them?

Listen, I'll come straight to the point. Just yesterday evening, Greek and Mazai went to the swamp looking for dog's tails, when they returned, they say they saw from a distance, three people. It seemed like two old hags, and a girl with them. They walked along the road towards them, and then turned to the right. Well, Greek and Mazai decided that they were locals, from the nearest village on the outskirts of the forest who had wandered in. They did not approach them, we try not to interfere. Although, they say, something seemed a little bit strange, a young girl like that being with them.
Where did they see these three?
Close by, come on, I'll mark the place on your PDA. There's an abandoned trailer and a broken armoured personnel carrier there, you'll find the place easily.
Thank you, I will go and catch up with them.
Cheers Strelok.
Hello you ugly old skank.
Hello dear little rude handsome man. What brings you here?
I'm looking for a girl, her name is Karina. The Hunters told me that they recently saw a young girl in the company of two older women. I understand that you are one of them.

Oh, you filthy beast! You want a girl? Well we have what you want. We have a girl, young and beautiful. She's cheap, only 3,000 rubles. Come and amuse yourself with her, relax. She's very pretty, you will not regret it.
What do you mean! I did not come for that. I have a job to find a girl named Karina. I have to talk to her. Let me go in, I need to see if she is Karina.

O-oh, my dear, you're so cunning. Look, speaking to her will cost you. You're so sly. First you pay, and then come in and do what you want with her. Our Grand-daughter is affectionate and responsive. If you don't agree my sister will blow your damn head off! So you will pay?
I have no money now. I'll try to get some from the Hunters.
Well to hell with you, you pervert. That'll cost me three thousand rubles.
Here take it!
Well, hello Karina.
O-oh, my head hurts ... what's wrong with me?
Don't worry, it'll soon pass. You must drink some Vodka, it helps.
And who are you? Where am I?
Don't worry, I'm a friend. You were captured by controllers, they decided to use you as bait. But now all is well. They no longer exist. My name is Strelok. I came for you. I was sent by Sviblov.
Lord I'm all in a daze ... who is ... Sviblov? And where am I now?
You are in the Forest. You came from the Dead City, your sister is Leila, and you were going to the Radar with your guide. Do you remember that?
Yes, now I remember ... the guide ... it’s the same ... he was killed by these creatures! There, on the hill. Only he knew the way.
Yes, I understand. Don't know you how to get back from the Forest to the Radar?
Am I a Stalker or a Digger? Of course I do not know!
Well I thought as much. But we need to get out of here. Do you have any thoughts? I know there is a path to the Military Warehouses somewhere. Do you know where?

No, no not there, there are enemies about. We must find the body of the guide. He should have in his pocket a PDA with the encrypted data of the Secret Paths. I know the code. If we find the PDA we can get out of the woods somehow. We should look. Come on I'll show the place where these creatures had attacked us, I remember now. Get me to the place, and then I'll should remember where to look.
Well let's go. Oh, by the way, you have a nice ass.
Is this the place?

Yes I remember now, this is where the guide was killed. While I was still conscious I saw that he was dragged down somewhere. There must be some kind of cave, I guess. I think so ... look on the slope. We need to find the corpse of the guide and pick up his PDA, otherwise let's get out of here. I'm scared!
Okay I'll try to find him, wait here and don't be afraid. If anything happens, just scream, then I come to the rescue.
I have found the guide's body.
Did you find his PDA?
Yes, here take it.
Let us look, where these paths from the Forest exist.
Well, have you found it?

Don't rush me ... yeah, here goes: you can get out of the Forest, but only to the Swamps. You can't get to the Radar from here. Okay, I'm sick of everything, my sister and Sviblov. I'm bored with them, always squabbling among themselves like dogs. I'll go to the Doctor. He's a good man. Moreover, I have helped him in his clinic. So I've decided. Let's go to the Swamps, to the Doctor!
Well to the Swamps we go. Lead on my beauty.
All right all right don't be afraid. The creature is dead. Apparently it was quietly following us all the way here. Well! What have we here, the transition to the Swamps?

U-uh, I cannot describe my fear. Yes the transition is here. There's a hole beside me to the left, you have to go down there. Where you end up in the Swamps is unknown. Every time you go through you will end up at a different place. Let's agree, you go first, and if I don't appear within a minute, I'll meet you at the Swamp Doctor's house. Oh and I may not have thanked you for my salvation, I'm sorry...ah ... well... thank you Strelok! You saved my ass.
Don't mention it. To save your ass was a pleasure! By the way, I had to pay 3,000 rubles for your release. After I killed the skanks I forgot to retrieve the money. Buggers!
So I was cheap, huh. Well maybe I will give you a reward later. Okay then it's time to go.
Yes, sounds good, let's not waste any more time.
Karina you've arrived before me. I am glad to see you are safe.
I was thrown out right near the gazebo in front of the Doctor's house. Shame there wasn't a hammock to land in rather that on the wooden floor. What took you so long?
I found myself in the southern part of the Swamps, so to get here it was necessary to swim. Though time is short, I'm soaked through and I need to dry off. We have much to do.
No, things can wait and we need to rest. This is probably the most peaceful place in the entire Zone. I probably will stay here at the Doctor's. I'll help him.
What about Sviblov and Leila? They're worried about you. I have to inform Sviblov that you are alive and well.
Don't worry, the Doctor will communicate the news to Leila through Grieg, as for Sviblov I'll contact him later.
Okay. But listen, how do I get out of the Swamps?
That's between you and the Doctor. Ask him.
Okay I'll talk to him. See ya!
Hello Doctor.
Glad to see you Strelok. Thank you for saving Karina, she briefly told me about your adventures.
It was nothing. I've been in tougher scrapes. Besides, I don't pass up a nice ass.
Well Strelok, a Stalker like you I have not seen before. You have a brave heart, a kind soul, and pure thoughts. These qualities are not often seen in the Zone.
Thank you for the compliment Doctor, now I have a question for you. How do I get out of the Swamps to somewhere close to the Bar?

I can help you. I have a guide dog named Mongrel. He will show you to one of the most secret and longest paths of the Zone. A transition from the Swamps through to the Dead City and down to Military Warehouses. This path was opened by my loyal friend and guide Pathfinder. But first I ask that you do one thing for me.
I'll listen to you carefully, Doctor.

In the southern part of the Swamps, in one of the old wooden houses, I installed a transmitter and antenna there. This is the best part of the bog for receiving a signal. Well in recent years three times the antenna broke, it had never happened before. The first time I went out to repair it, and a second time to fix everything. Well I think the wind or birds break it. Relocated the transmitter to another location and again the same thing. I went there a third time and there is no transmitter. I walked around and found it in a different place. I had a feeling that someone was watching me, I looked back, turned around and saw no one. I listened and heard some barely distinguishable sounds like a quietly sobbing child. Certainly not a bird, then I thought, maybe water? The whole problem could be rain. I had long not been afraid of any living creatures, but then ... in short, I quickly moved it again and put the transmitter and antenna in another location and left. But shortly before your arrival with Karina, again the same old song.
Sounds like devilry!

That's what I thought ... Well Strelok I beg you to go and find a reason for who or what keeps breaking my antenna. Get the transmitter. I'm sick of this mysticism. Although there is a signal, but not a very good one, I'm better off with Grieg's contacts at the Wanderers checkpoint. It will make me feel better. Strelok, I'll mark in your PDA where my transmitter is located.
Okay I'll go take a look to see what's happening and I'll bring back your instrument. I'm out of here!
I'm back Doctor. You were right when you suggested that it could be water.
I don't understand, Strelok. What do you mean?
In the place where you installed the receiver there were these little creepy spirit creatures wandering around in the water. Almost invisible, instead of blood they have acid, horrible.
So that's the reason. How many more miracles are in store for us today in the Zone? Anyway have you retrieved the unit?
Yes, here's your instrument, take it.
Well Doctor can your guide dog lead me to the Dead City now?

Yes Strelok. Now you can go. The guide dog will lead you. Just remember to find a way back from the Military Warehouses to the Swamps. I'm sure it will come in handy later. You'll have to talk to Pathfinder, give to him this flash drive, he will understand and show you the path. That's all. And now as the saying goes, follow the 'White Rabbit'. My dog is waiting for you in the gazebo near the house, it will take you to the place where the path begins. Take care of it, make sure nothing happens to him, this is a very valuable dog. I found it as a puppy, tamed and nurtured its instincts as a guide. It is an unrivalled seeker of the Secret Paths. Oh and note that it is very dangerous out in that area where you are going. Make sure Mongrel survives.
Okay Doctor. I will seek Pathfinder and will give him the flash drive. I got to go!
Goodbye Strelok, go with God!
Hey Pathfinder!
What do you want Strelok?
I've brought you something from the Swamp Doctor.
You saw the Doctor at the Swamps? How did you get there?
It's a long story. I had to bail someone out of trouble. The Doctor sends you this flash drive. Here take it.
Let us look, what's here... aha, I see. And what else did he say?
He said that you could show me a secret path from Military Warehouses through the Swamps to the Dead City. I've just come from there, but I need to get back.

Well since the Doctor helped you then I'll help you. This path is very convenient and can greatly prove to be useful. But there's one thing, to open this route is possible only with the help of the very rare artifact, called a 'Superconductor'. It has ability to displace time and space, thus creating space corridors, so-called Secret Paths, through which you can navigate previously inaccessible routes. It differs from its 'little brother transitions', the conductors of a lower order that activates the transitions on several routes. To activate it you just pick it up. For one thing to find this artifact is extremely difficult. It appears for only a short period of time, approximately for an hour, somewhere between one and two o'clock in the morning. If you do not find it in this time period then the artifact vanishes. So that's it.

Very interesting. I will try to find this 'Superconductor'. Painfully, finding the pathway is important; it's sure to come in handy in the future. Can you at least give a rough idea where I might find one?

Well, if the path you want to open begins in Military Warehouses, then you'll have to look around there. I've only ever found one in the Zone. Possibly look in the swamp or in the gully behind the abandoned farm. Precisely where to look is hard to say, but I think probably, in the almost inaccessible places. Just remember, time is limited for searching, just one hour, between one and two in the morning. If you find it, bring it to me and I'll open your transition to the Swamps through the Dead City. You have only three maybe four days to find it. If you don't find it in that time you'll have to wait a month to search again. So don't waste any time.
Everything is clear. Yeah a small problem, but I'll solve it. I'll find a 'Superconductor' and bring it to you.
Hello Pathfinder!
What new Strelok?
I found a 'Superconductor'. Look!
Wow! You're really an experienced searcher. Come on let's see where this trail from the Military Warehouses begins.
Take it.
What's the matter Barkeep?

While you were gone, I agreed with Sidorovich to muscle out another big business man. Only a few details remain. All the former strife I had with him is in the past. We are now friends. In short, Strelok, we need your help. If we succeed you'll get a very large reward for your labour.
What do I need to do?

I can't give you all the details yet, but one of the most important conditions for our case is the support of Duty. I have agreed to almost everything with General Voronin. Now we need to meet with Sidorovich personally. The meeting is scheduled for the near future at the Peacekeeping Corps in an abandoned village. Sidorovich most certainly will have bodyguards. I also need one with me, someone I can trust. You are the best candidate.
You want me to accompany you to the meeting with Sidorovich, right?

Yes yes, but first I ask you take this encrypted note to Voronin in the Dark Valley and give it to him personally. You will need to secretly go to Peacekeeping Corps, and it's not necessary to go through the checkpoint down here, and they don't need to know you're there. Then go from the Peacekeeping Corps back to the Dark Valley after our meeting. Remember, Voronin will tell you of a secret path back when you give him my message. And I will already be on my way. I know a short path to the Peacekeepers. I'll see you there near the abandoned village. I’ll let you know exactly when to leave the Dark Valley. I'll send a message to your PDA. Understand?
Yes, okay. Give me the letter, I'll go to Voronin.
General, I have a coded letter from Barkeep.
Glad to see you Strelok. You're just like a spy these days.
Barkeep encrypted it. He says it's very secret, and that nobody should know.

Yeah, he started a venture with Sidorovich, big freak'n deal. It just so happens that we have an interest in this case. Therefore from time to time my people will be involved. No one should know anything, otherwise it will fail.

I understand everything, so I won't bombard you with questions. Take the message from Barkeep. Incidentally, Barkeep said that you would show me a path out of the Dark Valley to the Peacekeeping Corps.
Yes, here I'll mark your PDA with the location of the transition point.
Here's the PDA, mark it, and I'll go.
Well Barkeep, where are we going?
Stay close, follow me. While I'm talking to Sidorovich, you're not to talk or listen. When I'm finished I'll tell you what to do next. All clear?
Copy that! Wasting time here!
Well is everything okay?
Yes, all the issues were discussed. Soon everything will be decided.
What's the next step?

Listen to me carefully. I still need to talk to Sidorovich face to face about something, and you need to go back to Voronin and give him another letter, the last one. In it are the final instructions as they say, and passwords for our common cause. Then later I will go to see Duty. Sidorovich is to take my place in the bunker at the Cordon. This is the first step in our plan. Once you give Voronin the message he will give you an answer for Sidorovich. By then Sidorovich should be at the Cordon. Take him the answer and he will say what to do next. Okay?
Yes everything is clear. I'll go to Voronin.
Hello General.
Well Strelok how are things?

Yes everything seems fine. Barkeep met Sidorovich in an abandoned village at the Peacekeeping Corps. I understand they had finally discussed all the details. Here's another coded message from Barkeep explaining the overall plans. You're to read it, then send a response to Sidorovich. He has moved to the Cordon. Barkeep has said that he'll meet with you soon.
Give me the message. Let's see what these sly dogs are proposing.
Here's the letter General.
Let's see what Barkeep has to say ... ah, they both offer ... it is clear, understandable. Okay, so let's try ... Strelok here is my answer to Sidorovich. Take it to him at the Cordon.
Yes sir, General.
Hey Sidorovich! You have a new store, congratulations!
Thanks, but I need to do a stock inventory first, and it wouldn't hurt to tidy the place up a bit. After a couple of days I can start trading. Have you brought a response from Voronin?
Yes of course. Here's the letter.
Let's see what our gallant General writes. Well, very good! Voronin is ready to begin. Well it's time for great achievements.
Have you finished with me? Barkeep promised me a reward.
Wait a minute Strelok the deal has not been finalized. The most difficult part still lies ahead of us, and we really need your help.
And what do I have to do?

Okay, I'll explain everything so that you understand the importance of what's happening. Earlier on Barkeep and I had bitter disputes over influential matters. He always claimed that I lured away his clients and underestimated the price of goods and so on. I, in turn, also had a list of claims. Working in this spirit had become unbearable, and Barkeep took the first step and proposed the following: I move to the Cordon and do fair trading in his old place. Some of his clients will be automatically transferred to me. He in turn was eager to move to the Bar. But as you know it has long been run by bandits. He then came up with a cunning plan to get rid of them.
And what is it? The Bandits are well entrenched in the Bar.

Just recently there has emerged a new militant group called Duty who would want to make a strong base at the Bar. But until they defeat the bandits they cannot. They can't do it single-handedly. Barkeep did not have connections among the Dutiers to get them to join forces. I at the time was a caterer for Voronin and his men, and had earned their respect. Barkeep asked me to discuss his plan with Voronin. The three of us talked and decided to work together. Barkeep will arrange the movement of a secret Duty strike force in the northern deserted area of the Bar, and I'll organize diversionary tactics against the Mercenaries at the southern outpost. The Bandits and their hirelings the Mercenaries will surely put up a good fight. Then a surprise attack from the north and the capture of the Bar by Duty, and Barkeep can take his rightful place at the Bar.
Look at what you've stirred up. Holy shit! Feel free to tell me more. What do you need from me?

Strelok you are actually the key person in this. We don't have enough details to carry out this plan. For a successful attack we need a detailed map of the Bar. You need to have someone draw you one, and you, as far as we know, have a good reputation among the lads, right? So please get us a map of the Bar and pass it to the Duty assault squad commander, Sergeant Plichko. The lads in the Bar have started to respect you more so they will help you overcome the Mercenaries at the southern checkpoint.
You guys have drawn me into some kind of feud! Okay I can dig it! Where do I get the Bar map, or are you suggesting that I survey the area and draw one up?

Firstly just listen. The plan is awesome. We thought of everything to the last detail. Borov has a map that's for sure. Once you help to eradicate the southern checkpoint of the Mercenaries suggest to Borov to strengthen both checkpoints and to protect against further such dangers. Tell him that you have friends, former construction workers, professional engineers, who at best can organize and budget. The Bandits won't help you, but if they offer, then be happy to accept, though they are scumbags they're not stupid. Tell Borov that to do everything properly, you need a map of his territory, which you supposedly need to plot the necessary dimensions and calculate all the details. He will be happy to give you the map.
Okay, you've talked me into it. I'll help you. I hope the reward will be decent.

Well that's good! So it's a deal. Now go to the Bar and see Borov. I'll let you know when to give Duty the go-ahead. When you get the map leave through the northern checkpoint and go to the right towards the Military Warehouses transition. Wait there for the Duty detachment and give the map to the Duty commander.

What have I become involved in, eh? One cannot escape the fact that many will be killed. There at the Bar I have many friends. We ought to warn them of the impending slaughter so that they can escape in the confusion.

Strelok if you're talking about Earl and Pathfinder then you need not worry. They are in the know. With Earl's help we succeeded in inciting an attack on the Mercenaries at the southern checkpoint. If you have any business left with these two do it now as most likely you won't be able to find them later in the Bar.
Okay I'll go.
Something else?
Yes, there was a person who came to me, he was looking for you.
Who was he?
It's a surprise! He's waiting for you at the entrance to my bunker.
Okay, I love surprises.
Something else?
Yes Strelok. Intelligence has it that you did something wrong at the Peacekeepers, that you stole a bulletproof vest. I was also told that something has happened to my old sidekick Mahomet.
Shit! I am looking for him. What happened?

Because they're always running into ambushes, once anyone steals Peacekeepers armour, they will have a seething hatred for you. But Mahomet was just someone who showed me the path to the Dark Valley, the same one I told you about. And you, apparently for a trophy, have led them to the transition. Did you take it?
Yes I did, but I had no other choice then!

You always have a choice Strelok. You just don't want to think about it. Because of this, a good man has died. The Peacekeepers killed him in their ambush. He ran and got shot in the forehead. He was out there waiting for you Strelok and was caught by accident.
Damn it I’m sorry about Mahomet, forgive me. Now I cannot find my brother.
Hello and who are you?
I am Mahomet. Didn't you expect to meet me here Strelok?
Damn! We finally meet! I've sought for a long time, Mahomet!
You were told I would find you, and now I have. So tell me why are you looking for me?

I have a very important task Mahomet. I'm looking for my brother, his name is Captain. Several years ago he was a member of a group which first attempted to enter the Sarcophagus at the Chernobyl NPP. With him were a few courageous Stalkers, including Yuri Semetsky. I have information that you have since met Semetsky, who was alive and unharmed. So, if Semetsky is still alive, then perhaps my brother is also alive, because they were the two from the group that went inside the Sarcophagus. Tell me what you know about it.

So that's it, Strelok! Actually, no one believes me that I have seen Semetsky alive, but it's true, and I met him twice. The first time was about one-and-a-half years ago. I saw a glimpse of him briefly in the forest at the Radar. He looked, well, not real. Whether it was a Zombie or a person, I couldn't tell, but it was him, I'm sure. There in the forest, it's full of anomalies and mutants, and he quickly disappeared somewhere.
When was the second time?

The second time was more recent, about two months ago. I was in Pripyat at the abandoned hospital. I was taking a small group of stalkers through the hospital on our way back from Pripyat to Yantar. That's where I met him and ... yes, his appearance was not for the faint-hearted. There was little left of him that was human, a walking corpse. He didn't let me get close to him. He muttered something about the Monolith, that they have long been held hostage by some 'dark forces' and their own stupidity. He said that he must fulfill his mission to destroy this 'evil stone'. In short, some kind of nonsense ... yes, I thought, he's not talking to me, but to himself. So if you want to find out what actually happened many years ago with your brother then you need to find Semetsky and somehow try to talk to him. Only he can help you.
Yeah, the story ... What do you think, where can I find him?
I think at the Chernobyl NPP, in the Sarcophagus. As I understood from his words, he is going to go there. Carry out his crazy mission.
Back to the Sarcophagus ... Yeah, it's a disastrous place, but I can't do anything about it, I'll have to go. There's just one more thing to finish here, with a bit of luck, I'll learn something.
Well, good luck to you Strelok. I'm glad we met.
Thank you for everything, Mahomet, it's time to go.
Hey, Barkeep! Well, it feels good.
Strelok, my friend, you have helped us, thank you!
Well, your thanks is not enough.
Don't be offended, I have not forgotten my promise to reward you generously. Here, take this from us all for your invaluable assistance - a hundred thousand in cash and a VKS snipers rifle.
Oh, that's really generous. Thank you!
Hello gorgeous!
You're funny Strelok, such a flirt.
Come on, the Zombies are dead. Life is getting better!
Thank you Strelok you helped us get rid of the Zombies once again, but we are moving away from the Dead City.
Why? Is something wrong?
No, it's just became too dangerous here. The City has now become not so dead. It's continually filling with crawling Zombies. In short we're leaving, we’ve had enough.
Fine, but I don't think that you're in danger from Zombies. There's something else here isn't there?

Yes Strelok, you’re almost right. We are leaving the Zone. We’ve had it. Now we can tell you the truth. We were looking for a very rare artefact, a 'Compass'. This artefact could have helped thousands of people to get rid of terrible diseases, but we could not find it. Apparently it does not exist, it was all a legend. So good-bye, but don't think badly of us. As for a reward for helping us we have nothing to give you.
C'mon do not worry Leila. Farewell I must go now.
I came for my brother!

That there Stalker, is no longer you brother. He has been freed from all superfluous and mundane things, an enlightened mind now. A mind that is capable of performing miracles, a mind that can rule the world.
Brother! I know you're there ... you're inside. Fight it! They took your mind, but you're a man! Fight back!

Stupid monkey. You cannot change anything! Go away and don't bother us. I suggest to you, before death, to see and enjoy this great spectacle. Soon we will begin our presentation. It won't be long. This will be a big show, the celebration of the force of the liberated mind!
Brother, wake up!! Wake up, Captain!! I know you can hear me! It's me, Strelok!
Don't waste your energy, it's all in vain before his death. It's far better to relax and enjoy this great and grand spectacle. After today, the world will be different.
I didn't come here just to surrender and observe, it's not that simple! I've learnt too much. Here Captain, catch! This is a 'Compass', with regards from Semetsky!
Brother, it's you!
Strelok, little-one, you've found me. Boy am I glad to see you! How did you find me?
Brother we can talk about it later. I also have lots of questions for you, but first we must get out of here real fast.

Little-one, I'm too weak to go anywhere now ... my head, my head ... is ringing like a bell ... legs ... my legs are weak. Listen to me brother, there is practically no time. The fact you set me free from this captivity does not change anything. The process of the regeneration of the Zone has already begun. All you've done is delayed its start. Go on save yourself! My place still seems to be here. Go brother one of us has to stay alive and get out of this damned Zone! Not far from here at the northern gate, there is a transition to Chernobyl-2. There you should take the road out of here. At least I hope you do.

No Captain I will not give up! Hear me now, I have a one-time personal Teleporter which can teleport you from any place in the Zone to the Swamps, to the Swamp Doctor. Therefore the plan is this, you take the instrument and teleport to the Doctor, you need his care right now. I will come later. I'll get out, do not worry. I got in here that means I can get back out.
Strelok, you don't understand who you're dealing with! They won't just let you leave, believe me, I know what I'm talking about. Time's running out.
Captain, let’s not waste precious minutes! Take the personal teleporter and go to the Doctor, I'll be alright. Don't worry! I have an idea.

Little-One, you've grown up. You are no longer a young romantic, you have become an adult, a soldier. I can see the fire in your eyes. Okay, so be it, I'll do as you suggest. But please do not get involved in anything, just run and don't look back. Go to Chernobyl-2, somewhere near the northern gate there is a portal. Oh, my heart feels for you. They will not just let you go. Okay, give me the teleporter and I'll go. God bless you my child! Time is running out - the sooner we begin...
Here take this personal teleporter and I'll see you brother.
Wtf!
Hello again! Unexpected, yes? We had warned you not to waste your time and energy on dubious activities. Have you really thought that here in the Zone you can make decisions and act independently?
I always make my own decisions and act on what my heart and mind tells me!

I'm afraid in this regard we have a different opinion. Oh well. You freed your brother, that's good, well done! So it was planned. For now you've delayed the Great emission, but there is nothing to worry about.
What do you mean, it was planned?

That means that you have once again proved your great power, though you were not clever enough to run away from us. Well that's good! And your brother ... we don't need him anymore, he has fulfilled his life. Now you will take his place!!
Noooooo!!!
Good day! Are you Sorcerer?
That's right, Stalker. What's brought you here?
I was told that you can revive the dead. I do not particularly believe in it, but for interest sake, I came here to find out.

You were not fooled, it is true. Here in the Zone there are more miracles than you ever dreamed of. Virtually every person who dies within areas of abnormal activity, I can bring back to life, or rather create a clone. However, it won't actually be human, but a Zombie. But most importantly though, his mind and memory, for a while, will be in the state that it was before his death.
Is this really possible? But how?

How - this is not your concern. I was 'on the other side of the world' and came back with such knowledge. So if you want to return the dead to this world, I am ready to help you. Only it will not come cheap. The cost of my 'work' - 100,000 rubles. And yet, to resurrect the man you request, is possible only if it does not kill you, okay?
I understood everything. If I suddenly need to revive someone, at least for a time, then I am sure I will return.
Sorcerer, I need to revive a dead man called Noodles.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Noodles to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little 'out of it'. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Miser.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Miser to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little 'out of it'. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Screw.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Screw to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little 'out of it'. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Lukash.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Lucas to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little 'out of it'. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Dan.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Dan to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a 'little out of it'. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Lefty.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Lefty to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little out of it. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive the dead, a man known as Sviblov.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Sviblov to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little out of it. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Sorcerer, I need to revive a dead stalker called Snitch.

Well, I knew that. Give me 100,000 rubles and I will return Snitch to this world. He will appear right here, close by, so do not be alarmed. For a while he will be a little confused. After a few minutes you will be able to talk to him normally.
Oh, I don't have enough money on me. I need to raise some more.
Agreed. Here, take this money.
Hey, Screw!
Hello, Strelok. What do you need?
I want to recharge a homemade flamethrower from Baker.
Well, let's try, but you understand, is not free.
How much are you asking for the job?

Well, firstly, to recharge this flamethrower I need one bottle of colloidal gas and a canister of gasoline. Secondly, for my work, a modest fee: two bottles of Vodka and 10,000 rubles. Is that Ok? If yes, give me the flamethrower, I'll start preparing for the recharge, and you go get what I need and bring it all back. Then I can recharge it.
Okay, I won't haggle with you. Take the flamethrower and I will get what is required and will return. Don't go anywhere!
Screw, I've brought what you need to recharge the flamethrower.
That's good. Have you got the money and Vodka for me?
Yes all of it.
Well let's have it and I can begin recharging your flamethrower.
Here take it.
Are you awake Vano?
Oh dear! How do you know me? What's your name?
Well the whole area knows about Vano - the most notorious boozer and brawler - a useless person. My name is Strelok.
Hey Strelok why are people saying bad things about Vano, eh? What have I done wrong? Vano is kind and cheerful. He hurts no one.

Look at you, you're a drunk - it will kill you if you don't stop drinking. Baker - he's a good guy, he cares about you, but it up you to change. There are many serious jobs he would like to give you, but he can't, he doesn't trust you..
Come on friend, I'll show them, Vano is in control of the situation. Vano is not a harsh person. Vano soon will go to Freedom, there Vano feels at home. Vano misses the place...
You wouldn't get a kilometre; you’re better off just putting a bullet in your head and be done with it. Freedom - these guys are serious, they don't tolerate rabble.
Vano not rabble! Vano is a Scout. Vano spent a whole week stalking Marauder whores. Vano found something very important.
And what did Vano find that is so important?

Don't mock me. Vano pursued the Marauders from the very base of the Peacekeepers. They had stolen a Peacekeeper's box of mines and were carrying it to the abandoned village. But they didn't get there ... in the swamp they were chased by some sort of phantom creatures... If Vano had an automatic weapon, then I would have dealt with them, so I just hid and watched, as they skedaddled out, dropping the loot.
Well have to go pick up that box and return it to the Peacekeepers. These guys are generous and reward well.

No no! Peacekeepers are evil; they once did something bad to Vano. Vano does not like them. This is what Vano proposes: you're the one with the weapon, Vano has none and is scared and a little sick. So now you go to that eerie swamp, find the box and bring it to Vano. Vano will take this box to Freedom. Doing this, Vano will gain some respect. Well, will you bring it? Vano will be in your debt forever and I will give part of the contents of the box. Vano is an honest man.
Well, to hell with you. Give me a marker as to where to search for this box and I will go.

That's good! It's simple, the swamp is not far from here. Vano can put a marker on your map. You should look for the box in the swamp near an old sunken row boat, it's not deep there. Look down in the water. Look Strelok, just be careful out there. And on the way back be careful as well because there are constantly Marauders nearby. Although they are cowardly creatures many of them are dangerous.
Give me a marker so I can go find the box of mines in the swamp.
Enough drinking, Vano. You'll die from too much vodka.
Yes, you're right Strelok, I must give up drinking.
I found the box of mines in the swamp. On the way back I ran into some Marauders. I should have dealt with them, we've brought Baker some trouble.

Holy shit! Jackpot! Give them to me; I will give you two kinds of mines, five of each. If you want, you can secretly mine the entire base of these freaks - the Peacekeepers. That would be fun to watch, as those bastards soar into the air! But you must first read the instructions for how to use them.
Thanks for the wise advice, yes you could do it to the Peacekeepers, but I advise you not to. Okay, keep the box of mines.
Well Stalker, have you recovered?
Oh, you sewer rat! You're a cowardly creature, you only know how to sneak up from behind.

You're behaving like a juvenile, Stalker! The only reason you're still alive, is because we have a very important question for you. As you've probably noticed, we have your swag. Do you want peace, and your belongings returned? Well, we want that box that you pulled from the swamp, it belongs to us.
Had you met me face to face you louse we would have worked out who's who.
I see! You're half a step from death, and you show impudence. Are you a fearless hero or what? Huh?
Asshole!
You call me an asshole. What's next, some sort of heroics?
Oh, you bastard! Well let's finish this. What do I need to do?

That is another matter. So listen here: I understand that you can easily walk in to the Peacekeepers base, right? I know for sure you can. So, you can fetch for us two SCAT-11M bullet-proof vests, from the Peacekeepers. Finding things is in your genes. The body armour should be in a house that is close to the entrance to the base. I'll mark its location on your PDA. I don't think that the Peacekeepers will just let you go, if they see you steal their body armour. So here's my advice to you: after you take the body armour, find a different way out of the base, or be shot by the Peacekeepers. There is another way out. I don't think you want to fight with them, but that's your problem. And don't try to scam us - you'll regret it!
Okay you rat, I'll get what you asked for. Just take care of my stuff.

Yes hombre, you've got work to do. But there’s more. Don't interfere with Baker anymore, we'll kill you on the spot. He is our client. We have been watching him for some time. Soon a parcel will arrive for him and then the bunker will be history. So if you get it in your head to warn him, you will die.
Yes I understand everything. I'll be back!.
Well the hero returns. Have you brought the two SCAT-11M body armours?
I've brought them.
That's good. Give them here.
Where are my possessions?
Like I said they're being guarded. Give me the armour!
Okay, here's the body armour, take it. Now give me my suit and weapons.
Well, you're a dickhead, man!
I don't understand.
Hello General! I have something to tell you.
Tell me what it is Strelok.
I was captured by the Marauders and taken to the abandoned village. They stripped me to the bone. They took everything, my weapons and armour.
Bad luck, Strelok. Well, at least you got out alive.

General, you don't understand. In order to my gear back the Marauders ordered me to get two sets of SCAT-11M body armour, to steal them from your base. But I didn't want to do it so I come to you for help.
You are an honest man Strelok! How exactly can I help you?
Give me a weapon and some ammunition, five grenades and a couple of fighters and we will rid the village of these Marauders.

Well Strelok I can't spare any people because we have planned a major operation in the southern part of the territory. So that every weapon counts. I can give you an M16 rifle with an integrated optical sight, some ammo for it, and a couple of grenades, a first aid kit and bandages, and another set of SCAT-11 M body armour. I think you can handle these Marauders yourself. Okay?
Good General. Well, it will be even better to deal with them myself and get my stuff back. Thank you very much! I'll go and deal with these rats.
